questions.question_text: What makes single cloud assets less resilient compared with a traditional infrastructure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
6.0.1.1 Architect for Failure
Cloud platforms can be incredibly resilient, but single cloud assets are typically less resilient than in the case of traditional infrastructure. This is due to the inherently greater fragility of virtualized resources running in highly-complex environments.
A. The cloud consumer is responsible.

questions.question_text: ENISA: In Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), who is responsible for guest systems monitoring?
What are the components of an encryption system?

discussion.content: 11.1.4.2 -There are three components of an encryption system: data, the encryption engine, and key management.

choices.D: Data, encryption engine, and key management
choices.C: User, encryption engine, and key management
choices.B: Data, encryption engine, and decryption tool

questions.question_text: What is the main data source for detection and analysis of an incident?

discussion.content:
9.1.1. Alerts [endpoint protection, network security monitoring, host monitoring, account 
creation, privilege escalation, other indicators of compromise, SIEM, security analytics 
(baseline and anomaly detection), and user behavior analytics]

questions.question_text: Which cloud storage technology would include a content delivery network (CON), files stored in SaaS, and caching?

discussion.content:
Application/platform: Examples of these would be a content delivery network (CDN), files stored in 
SaaS, caching, and other novel options.

Selected Answer: C
Application/platform: Examples of these would be a content delivery network (CDN), files stored in SaaS, caching, and other novel options.
